title: Full School Curriculum
contentSummary:
Parent Overview:
The Class 5 Scholar Program is designed to reinforce academic excellence while nurturing independent thinking and research skills. It fully supports your child’s school curriculum — including assignments, projects, class tests, and long-form assessments — while making space for interdisciplinary learning and creative exploration.

Subjects covered include English, Hindi, Mathematics, Science, Social Studies, GK, Value Education, Art, and more — with activities designed to build curiosity, responsibility, and comprehension.

What makes us different:
- Structured Rayastra’s kit with all expert learning amenities at your home
- Personalized teacher-parent meetings and feedback sessions
- School-given tests, assignments, and research-based projects fully supported
- Weekly academic modules with creative assignments, worksheets, and concept maps
- Parent+Child Progress Dashboard for tracking academic consistency and soft skills
- Merit Badges for subject mastery, project quality, research attitude, and discipline
- Prepares children for upper primary with a balance of academics and innovation

title: Computer Science
contentSummary:
Parent Overview:
Class 5 CodeVoyagers builds real-world coding awareness and problem-solving skills. Children explore Scratch programming, creative digital projects, introduction to website structure, ethical tech use, and basic logic flows — all with age-appropriate tools. The program moves learners from visual blocks to understanding how actual digital products work.

Your child becomes a creator — not just a user — of technology.

What makes us different:
- Structured Rayastra’s kit with all expert learning amenities at your home
- Personalized teacher-parent meetings and feedback sessions
- Scratch-based projects, flowcharts, logic trees, and digital design
- Brain Gym & Logic Vault with layered logic challenges and real-world case studies
- Mini-projects include game prototypes, animations, and interactive designs
- Parent+Child Dashboard to visualize growth in tech fluency and creative output
- Builds confidence for AI, web, and Olympiad-level logic development in future grades

title: Spoken & Written English
contentSummary:
Parent Overview:
The Class 5 program enhances fluency in both spoken and written English. Learners develop clarity in speech, tone modulation, accent refinement, and confidence in public speaking, while also working on grammar, essay writing, vocabulary, and comprehension. Language becomes a tool for both expression and critical thinking.

It also encourages optional multilingual exposure through global languages available on Duolingo.

What makes us different:
- Structured Rayastra’s kit with all expert learning amenities at your home
- Personalized teacher-parent meetings and feedback sessions
- Advanced grammar, storytelling, informative writing, and presentation techniques
- Public speaking sessions, speech recordings, and vocabulary games
- Lights, Camera, Confidence! for guided expression, accent polishing, and clarity
- Optional multi-language training - may it be French, German, or any other
- Builds versatile language users who can perform, express, and write with clarity

title: Mathematics
contentSummary:
Parent Overview:
Class 5 MathMagicians develop strong mental math and reasoning abilities with practical math applications. The focus is on solving multi-layered problems, understanding data, applying math to life, and getting Olympiad-ready through logic challenges and projects that go beyond the textbook.

Children don’t just solve equations — they build the thinking to solve anything.

What makes us different:
- Structured Rayastra’s kit with all expert learning amenities at your home
- Personalized teacher-parent meetings and feedback sessions
- Topics include decimals, factors, multiples, perimeter, volume, and data handling
- Brain Gym activities with real-world math: travel planning, measurements, conversions
- Merit Badges for fluency, accuracy, speed, and logic application
- Project-based tasks: budget design, surveys, fraction games, and math in nature
- Builds strong conceptual understanding and Olympiad-level application ability
